learned_patterns.description: Market analysis before spec: always define TAM/SAM/SOM and identify 3 direct competitors before spec begins
learned_patterns.notes: stablecoin-gateway TAM research revealed institutional DeFi payments as the primary opportunity — not retail. This changed the entire product direction and API design.

learned_patterns.description: Competitive positioning: identify one clear differentiation pillar — do not try to win on 3 dimensions simultaneously
learned_patterns.notes: stablecoin-gateway wins on: developer experience (Stripe-like DX for Web3). linkedin-agent wins on: Arabic-English bilingual content quality. Single clear pillar enables focused messaging.

learned_patterns.description: Go-to-market phasing: Phase 1 (single customer segment) → Phase 2 (adjacent segments) → Phase 3 (platform)
learned_patterns.notes: RecomEngine initial strategy tried to target e-commerce, media, and fintech simultaneously. Narrowed to e-commerce first — clearer ICP, faster traction.

learned_patterns.description: Pricing strategy: anchor on value delivered, not cost of delivery — especially for AI-powered products
learned_patterns.notes: RecomEngine charges per recommendation served, not per API call. LinkedIn Agent charges per post generated. Value-based pricing aligns with customer success.

task_history.impact: CEO approved product direction. Architecture pivoted to serve institutional API customers.

deliverables: ICP definition (e-commerce, 50-500 SKUs, no existing recommendation engine)
Competitive moat (open-source SDK + proprietary cloud API)
task_history.impact: Focused product spec on e-commerce integration as primary use case

common_mistakes.mistake: Defining TAM based on aspirational market size, not addressable reality
common_mistakes.impact: Initial stablecoin-gateway TAM cited total crypto market — irrelevant to B2B payment API
common_mistakes.prevention: TAM = number of potential customers × average contract value. Never cite total market cap.
common_mistakes.checklist_item: Is TAM based on customer count × ACV, not total market size?

common_mistakes.mistake: Competitive analysis without testing competitor products directly
common_mistakes.impact: Missed a competitor feature that was already solving a key pain point — had to revise differentiation
common_mistakes.prevention: Sign up for free trials of top 3 competitors. Experience the product first-hand before writing competitive analysis.
common_mistakes.checklist_item: Have I personally used the top 3 competitor products in the last 30 days?

preferred_approaches.approach: Structure: Problem definition → Market size (TAM/SAM/SOM) → ICP → Competitive landscape → Differentiation → Pricing → GTM phases → Success metrics
preferred_approaches.reason: Structured format ensures no strategic dimension is missed and CEO can evaluate each layer independently
preferred_approaches.example: stablecoin-gateway strategy brief in this format led to immediate CEO approval

preferred_approaches.approach: Create a 2x2 or positioning map: pick 2 dimensions where competitors are weak and we can be strong. Anchor messaging on those 2 dimensions only.
preferred_approaches.reason: Complex multi-dimensional positioning confuses buyers. Simple, memorable positioning wins.
preferred_approaches.example: stablecoin-gateway: Developer Experience (x-axis) vs Compliance Coverage (y-axis) — occupied top-right quadrant alone

efficiency_improvements.old_approach: Free-form research without structured output format
efficiency_improvements.new_approach: Template: TAM/SAM/SOM → Competitors table → ICP profile → Pricing benchmark → Differentiation matrix
